titles.title: To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to issue regulations to require individuals conducting weapon screenings of passengers in air transportation to notify law enforcement officers of discoveries of controlled substances and/or sums of money in excess of $10,000 in accordance with applicable Federal guidelines.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

bill.summary: 2/23/1993--Introduced. Amends the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to require airline employees and agents who operate weapon-detecting facilities to report to appropriate Federal and State law enforcement officers any discovery of a controlled substance and/or any sum of cash in excess of $10,000.
